name: heterozygosity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of having two different forms of a gene (= part of a cell containing DNA information) that controls a particular characteristic, one from each parent, and therefore able to pass on either form: The loss of heterozygosity in both sporadic and hereditary forms of basal cell carcinoma suggests that it functions as a tumour suppressor. Related word
heterozygous
More examplesFewer examplesThe prevalence of apparent heterozygosity for Pyruvate Kinase Deficiency has been estimated to be around one percent. Lobular carcinoma in situ and invasive ductal carcinoma have been shown to exhibit similar loss of heterozygosity.
